alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:03PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Somerset and north central Middlesex Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 602 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plainfield, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, East Brunswick, North Brunswick, Middlesex, Bound Brook, Manville, Millstone, Martinsville, North Brunswick Township, Society Hill, South Plainfield, North Plainfield, South River, Highland Park, Metuchen, Spotswood and Dunellen. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 10. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 36 and 43. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
